6)	Planned changes to improve safety:

The facility conducts internal and third party compliance audits to ensure that the level of safety protection at the site is periodically evaluated for improvements. The facility will also have an ongoing dialogue with the St. James Parish Office of Emergency Preparedness to ensure a constant state of readiness to respond to any potential emergencies, as well as a means to implement improvements as the need develops.

Koch Methanol St. James, LLC - Risk Management Plan Executive Summary

1)	Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:

Koch Methanol St. James is designed with layers of protection to prevent accidental releases.  Operators are trained in the process operation and fire fighting techniques. The facility has an Emergency Response Plan with an imbedded third party response team to assist with fire brigade, hazardous materials, high angle rescue, and medical response. Employees are trained in hazardous materials.

2)	Stationary source and regulated substances handled:

Koch Methanol St. James is located at 6586 Highway 3127 in St. James Parish, Louisiana. The facility produces methanol from natural gas.  The regulated substance handled are flammable mixture which mostly contains methane and ethane.  There are no other regulated substances above threshold quantities at the site.

3)	The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:

Although Koch Methanol St. James is classified as Program 1 under RMP, elements of the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) are followed where appropriate. Koch Methanol St. James has implemented the following PSM elements:  including Employee Participation, Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Contractor Management, Pre-Startup Safety Review, Mechanical Integrity, Hot Work, Management of Change, Incident Investigation, Emergency Planning and Response, Compliance Audits, and Trade Secrets 

4)	The five-year accident history:

The facility began operations in June 2021 and there have been no releases meeting the 5-year Accident criteria prior to startup.
